[[Image:Ted Nasmith - Departure at the G: The '''White Ship''' was the ship that sailed from the [[Grey Havens]] into the [[Uttermost West]], carrying the [[Ring-bearers]] to Aman. Its departure on [[29 September]] {{TA
thumb: 3021}} marked the end of the [[Third Age]].<ref>{{App
350px: Ring-bearer]] and [[Bilbo Baggins]] the [[Ring-finder]] the ship also carried [[Elrond]], [[Galadriel]], and [[Gandalf]], who had been the [[Keepers of the Three Rings]]. They were accompanied to the Grey Havens by [[Gildor
[[Ted Nasmith]] - ''Departure at the Gre: Gildor Inglorion]] and many other Elves besides, but whether any of these others went aboard the ship with them is not told.<ref>{{RK
column6: VI9}}</ref> It does seem, though, that Gandalf's horse [[Shadowfax]] did make the journey for he was waiting at the quayside<ref>{{L
column7: 268}}</ref>. The White Ship was one of the last ships to have set sail from the Grey Havens.

[[Image:Ted Nasmith - Departure at the G: '''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
In the film, the White Ship is claimed to be "the last ship to leave Middle-earth".
